StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersColonizationTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of colony modules and basic colony buildings.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersColonizationTech_Dec
StringTable.String: For generations mankind has dreamed of setting foot on other worlds. That dream is now a reality. Feet are being set on other worlds. We're setting lots of things on other worlds actually.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersXenoIndustrializationTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved colony buildings.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersXenoIndustrializationTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Everything is harder on the surface of an alien world, every machine we own having to be adjusted for the differences in gravity or atmosphere, all our old constants and empirical shortcuts having to be thrown out and re-written.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIndustrialSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: There's no sense stopping at "basic competence" when it comes to making things in alien environments. We should probably learn from the many mistakes we're still making, for example.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIndustrialSpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our rapidly expanding frontiers have made available thousands and thousands of new things to look at under a microscope. Expanding our research capabilities will allow our scientists to keep up.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIndustrialSpecialization3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces the cost of building manufacturing and research centers.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIndustrialSpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Having found out what works and doesn't work on alien planets, we've been able to standardize and modularize our building construction practices a bit, which should reduce building costs across our civilization.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersAdvancedConstruction_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced manufacturing facilities.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersAdvancedConstruction_Dec
StringTable.String: Advances in material sciences has given us the tools to build bigger and bolder, to finally catch up with some of the wilder imaginings our architects have come up with.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersConstructionOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Every time we ramp up the scale of our manufacturing, we also ramp up the scale of our mistakes. It takes time and effort to weed those out, but it needs to be done if we want to reach our true manufacturing potential.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersConstructionOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: We resisted letting the accountants into the manufacturing centers for a long time, because the work is dangerous and also because no-one likes them. But once they found a way to sneak in, they did admittedly find several ways to cut manufacturing costs.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersConstructionOptimization3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces maintenance costs of manufacturing plants.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersConstructionOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Factories and manufacturing plants generate a lot of toxic byproducts which are expensive to dispose of. By making our manufacturing processes even a bit less wasteful, we expect to see broad cost savings over the life of a plant.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersXenoManufacturingMethods_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic manufacturing facilities.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersXenoManufacturingMethods_Dec
StringTable.String: Some of our more precise manufacturing processes have resisted the move off-world, adapting them to a broad range of planetary and micro-gravitational environments proving to be a surprisingly challenging endeavor. We think we've got it now, but nevertheless still recommend you invest in extended warranties.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersManufacturingFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Tooling our manufacturing centers to specialize in military production sends a pretty unfriendly message to anyone paying close attention to us. But it should make everyone in adaptive camo fatigues happy.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersManufacturingFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: One of the unforeseen side-effects of managing a civilization on this scale is finding things to do with all these people. Keeping them happy is as important as keeping them safe, and they can sometimes be pretty difficult about it.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersManufacturingFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: We thought we cleared them out after the last time, but some more accountants managed to slip into our manufacturing centers. Or they're living in the walls now. Regardless, they've found some more ways for us to reduce our manufacturing overhead.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIndustrialExpertise_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate manufacturing facilities.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIndustrialExpertise_Dec
StringTable.String: By manipulating materials at the level of individual atoms, we can now construct things of unparalleled precision and complexity. Which has massively expanded our industrial capacity, along with creating an entirely new class of pretty terrifying workplace safety issues.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIndustrialMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: We're slowly eking out the last possible efficiencies of our military manufacturing processes. Our civilization is now essentially a war machine itself.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIndustrialMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: Few of our civilians seem to realize the challenge of constructing the farms, hospitals, and entertainment complexes that they rely on to survive. And yet every time we try to tell them they just yawn and walk away.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPracticalFusion_Dec
StringTable.String: Cascading fusion reactors will allow our manufacturing plants to be more effective. Although these represent an enormous security risk, even the most vicious heretics wouldn't be foolish enough to tamper with them.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersQuantumPower_Dec
StringTable.String: By tapping into the quantum zero point energy of a vacuum, our physicists claim that we now have access to a massive source of power. It's not infinite, but boy is there ever a lot of it.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInstitutionalResearch_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved research facilities.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInstitutionalResearch_Dec
StringTable.String: We're at our best when we're not just living in this universe, but observing it. Figuring it out. Sometimes dismantling small parts of it. By setting up special places for that to happen, we expect research breakthroughs to occur much more frequently.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersResearchOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: We've improved and made more efficient many of our research practices, which should lead to faster research, or at the very least, less researchers complaining about red tape.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersResearchOptimization2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces the manufacturing cost of research improvements.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersResearchOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: In the rush to begin processing and analyzing all the new data our rapid expansion has provided, managerial oversight has slackened, and a number of horribly wasteful research practices became commonplace. By eliminating those we should be able to make our research quite a bit cheaper.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersResearchOptimization3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces maintenance costs of research improvements.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersResearchOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Research labs are full of expensive toys which are in a near constant state of breaking down. By considering even a bit how to do some of this more sustainably, we expect to see broad cost savings over the life of a lab.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersResearchCenters_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced research facilities.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersResearchCenters_Dec
StringTable.String: By putting all of our smartest people and their favorite toys into the same building, we expect to see significant improvements in our ability to research new fields. Also, we'll give them food so they have no reason to leave.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersTechnologicalFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: By focusing our efforts on pure research we have been able to get a significant improvement on the rate of new discoveries.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersTechnologicalFocus2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces the Cost of Research improvements.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersTechnologicalFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: By focusing our efforts on our research infrastructure we have been able to cut down the cost of building new facilities.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersTechnologicalFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: By focusing how our researchers work and eliminating some of the more wasteful experiments, we have been able to significantly reduce the maintenance of our research facilities.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIntegratedResearch_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic research facilities.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIntegratedResearch_Dec
StringTable.String: In the last few years we've made great strides in our understanding of the universe, and now require larger academies to facilitate the multi-disciplinary studies needed to push back the veil further. The researchers are also demanding something called a "faculty bar."

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersResearchMatrixTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate research facilities.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersResearchMatrixTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Imagine the benefit of millions of scientists, working away in a city-sized research facility, with none of the distractions of the outside world like weather or family or basic social contact. Yes, a few of them will probably turn into psychopaths, but we were planning to keep an eye on them anyways.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDeeperKnowledge_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of deep research facilities.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDeeperKnowledge_Dec
StringTable.String: In the past years our understanding of the universe has grown by leaps and bounds. Teams who have made an effort to slow down and consider some of the implications of these discoveries are now revealing deeper patterns in the fabric of reality.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersQuantumUnderstanding_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved deep research facilities.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersQuantumUnderstanding_Dec
StringTable.String: We're no longer groping blindly at the edge of the sub-atomic world. For one thing, our researchers are pretty sure there are actually twenty eight edges to the sub-atomic world, that they're less edges than toroids, and that there are actually now zero of them. It turns out that reality is super complicated.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBeyondMortality_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced deep research facilities. Prepares civilization for Ascension.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBeyondMortality_Dec
StringTable.String: Ascension will make us immortal, and usher us into a reality that is beyond this one. What lies there remains a mystery, but we've never backed away from those before.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersResearchCoordination_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of research support facilities.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersResearchCoordination_Dec
StringTable.String: Coordinating research teams scattered across multiple worlds has only gotten more challenging as our civilization has grown. Research Coordination Centers should help ease that challenge, and minimize any duplication of effort.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersNeroLinking_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved research support facilities.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersNeroLinking_Dec
StringTable.String: The benefits of direct brain-to-brain communication will be felt in a wide variety of fields, but considering how socially awkward many of our researchers are, we suspect they'll profit the most from living in a world without small talk.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPlanetaryImprovement_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of civilian buildings. Increases population growth.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPlanetaryImprovement_Dec
StringTable.String: Half the fun of moving to a new place is fixing it up to suit your needs. That's harder when the new place is an entire alien planet, but we're finally developing the tools and techniques to do just that.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPlanetarySpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our farming technology has improved dramatically, and we're beginning to see enhanced crop yields as a result.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPlanetarySpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we're able to modulate the effects an alien world has on fertility, our population growth rates are beginning to trend upwards. More babies for now, but more workers soon enough.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPlanetarySpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: We're no longer just surviving on new worlds, but thriving there. Thanks to improved nutrient yields and preservation techniques, our workers can work longer and harder, improving the production capacity of our entire civilization.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersXenoAgriculturalAdaptation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved farms. Increases food production.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersXenoAgriculturalAdaptation_Dec
StringTable.String: Adapting our agricultural expertise to fit a variety of alien environments has proven very difficult, and taken many simultaneous advances in our understanding of soil, atmospheric science, and shovels. That's right. On some planets, we need special shovels.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersAgriculturalOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Adapting our planting, feeding, and harvesting regimens to account for differences in the seasons of alien worlds takes a lot of effort and has to be fine tuned on every planet. But now that we're able to do it, we expect to see greater food yields.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersAgriculturalOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we have more experience growing food on alien worlds, our agricultural engineers are able to predict in advance what farming equipment a colony will need before its formed, leading to lower startup costs.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersAgriculturalOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: By taking a step back from the cutting edge of agriculture science, and using older, more reliable equipment, we can reduce the costs of running most of our farms.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIntensiveFarming_Dec
StringTable.String: Maximizing the food production of a given plot of soil is an expensive but very necessary step for those worlds where arable land comes at a premium.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersFarmingFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: The microbes present in alien soil react differently to nutrients than we're used to, and it's taken awhile to fine tune our fertilization techniques to keep our own plants fed. But now that we have, we expect to see even greater food production.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersFarmingFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: We've finally homed in on the species and strains of plants which adapt to the widest range of environments. By focusing our production efforts on these crops, the startup costs for any farm should now be much more manageable.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersFarmingFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Farmers throughout our civilization are tackling unique agricultural challenges every day. By implementing civilization-wide information sharing systems, we can spread our best practices further, reducing farming operational costs everywhere.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLosslessFarming_Dec
StringTable.String: Improvements in our recycling and nutrient delivery systems have led to almost perfectly efficient farms. Our farmers don't even need to get their hands dirty now, and are actually getting a bit precious about it.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersAgriculturalMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our food production capacity has taken another step forward. Also, we've finally gotten that weird taste out of micro-gravity raised carrots.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersAgriculturalMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: We have such an excess quantity of food now that many of our people have taken it almost as a challenge to create families capable of consuming it all.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersFoodDistributionTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of farming support buildings. Increases food production.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersFoodDistributionTech_Dec
StringTable.String: It sounds boring, and it is also actually boring, but thanks to advances in xeno-accounting and the resulting improvement in the logistics of our food distribution system, we're now saving a lot of food which had previously gone to waste.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersXenoIrrigation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved farming support buildings. Increases food production.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersXenoIrrigation_Dec
StringTable.String: There are a number of surprising challenges when irrigating an alien planet, related to the unique gravity, soil, and atmosphere we might find there. Also, the water is often hiding.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBiomassResequencing_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced farming support buildings. Increases food production.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBiomassResequencing_Dec
StringTable.String: Fundamentally, food is little more than long chains of carbon arranged into molecules that we find digestible and tasty. Plants and animals have done a fine job of sequencing these chains to date, but isn't it time we maybe let a robot take a crack at it?

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersXenoBiology_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved medical facilities. Increases population growth.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersXenoBiology_Dec
StringTable.String: Understanding how our old familiar plants grow on alien worlds will be critical to our chances of survival when colonizing the stars. And if we want to avoid destroying the biosphere of our new homes, we'd better have a handle on what our germs are about to do to them too.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPopulationEnhancement_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced medical facilities. Increases population growth.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPopulationEnhancement_Dec
StringTable.String: It takes a lot of the romance out of it, but for our colonies to succeed, they need babies, and they need them quickly. This research into fertility enhancement and mood music should help.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBioReplication_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic medical facilities. Increases population growth.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBioReplication_Dec
StringTable.String: It turns out that once we took all of the fun parts out of reproduction, we could dramatically increase our growth rates. Sure bio-replication might be ushering us into a nightmarish world of conformism and fewer available parking spaces, but we're sure we'll manage somehow.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEnvironmentalEngineering_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows soil enhancement and improves adjacency terrain effects.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEnvironmentalEngineering_Dec
StringTable.String: Our ability to improve and enhance the environment we work in will provide benefits to almost every aspect of colonization, and make walks in the outdoors a little less deadly.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersExtremeWorldColonization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows settlement on extreme worlds, at reduced production potential.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersExtremeWorldColonization_Dec
StringTable.String: No longer are we limited to the low-hanging fruit of the galaxy's stock of planets. It won't be an easy life for anyone living on these new worlds, but it will be a life.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersColonizationFocus1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Normalizes Production of Aquatic Worlds, and boost their wealth and Tourism.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersColonizationFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our experience dealing with the challenges of life on aquatic worlds has allowed us to make living there almost as comfortable as anywhere else in our civilization. Bathing caps are no longer mandatory.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersColonizationFocus2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Normalizes Production of Frozen Worlds, and boost their Research and Influence.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersColonizationFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: We're now so good at living on snowball worlds, that many colonists go days at a time without using mittens, something which would have been considered wildly reckless even a few years ago.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersColonizationFocus3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Normalizes Production of Barren Worlds, and boost their Manufacturing and Military.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersColonizationFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: It took some expensive, massively invasive water recycling technology to do it, but life on barren worlds is now more or less as productive as anywhere else. The catheters are now much more comfortable too.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersAtmosphericCleansing_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows settlement on radioactive and toxic worlds, at reduced production potential.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersAtmosphericCleansing_Dec
StringTable.String: Even the foulest and most toxic planetary environments can now be colonized by us. Good luck to the poor bastards who go for it, but at least they'll now have a fighting chance.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBiospherePerfection1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Normalizes Production of Radioactive Worlds, and boost their Manufacturing output.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBiospherePerfection1_Dec
StringTable.String: The mutations and genetic defects which were a fact of life for the early colonists of radioactive worlds are now a thing of the past. Any further mutations are now for cosmetic purposes only.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBiospherePerfection2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Normalizes Production of Toxic Worlds, and boost their Research output.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBiospherePerfection2_Dec
StringTable.String: We have mastered the challenges of living on even the most poisonous of planets. You still won't want to go outside without your helmet, but we've moved most of the places worth going to inside anyways.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersTerraformingTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Terraforming is a tricky business, delicately poised between making the world more habitable for us, without destroying an entire biosphere to do so. And there aren't any do-overs.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHabitatImprovement_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced terraforming plants.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHabitatImprovement_Dec
StringTable.String: Our ability to manipulate the biosphere has improved to the point that we can treat entire continents as a canvas. Will we paint a portrait of a thriving and prosperous civilization? Or the equivalent of writing our names in the snow in urine?

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSoilReclamation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows the use of almost useless terrain.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSoilReclamation_Dec
StringTable.String: Many planets do a very poor job of making terrain usable for colonial purposes. Where nature has dropped the ball, we've stepped in, and are now capable of developing what were once very marginal locations.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEnvironmentalResequencing_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases the amount of usable land on all colonized planets.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEnvironmentalResequencing_Dec
StringTable.String: We're playing with powerful forces now, capable of manipulating planetary terrain on a scale never before seen in history. We must use this power wisely, or at least not actively for evil.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEngineeringTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of hyperdrives and tiny hulls.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEngineeringTech_Dec
StringTable.String: For generations, we've looked up at the stars and wondered, "What if?" Well buckle up, because "if" has happened. By bending space around our ships, they're able to use conventional propulsion within a pocket of normal space, while accelerating at vastly greater speeds in reality. The stars have gotten closer.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInterstellarTravel_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Improves sensor, life support, and speed of all ships.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInterstellarTravel_Dec
StringTable.String: Even at the incredible speeds we can travel at now, if we want to journey anywhere beyond the closest stars, we'll need to make significant improvements to our navigational and life support systems. More refined hyperdrives wouldn't hurt either.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInterstellarSpecialization1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases the speed of all ships.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInterstellarSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: After analyzing how our first generation of hyperdrives have (and haven't) worked, we've come up with a number of ways to improve our ship's speeds.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInterstellarSpecialization2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces the Mass of Colony & Constuctor modules.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInterstellarSpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Pushing large Support Modules through space is inherently wasteful, by miniaturizing and optimizing the larger components, we can fit more on a ship, allowing them to go further, and faster than ever.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInterstellarSpecialization3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases the range of all ships.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInterstellarSpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: After listening to the complaints and coughs of our returning crews, we've improved the life support recirculation systems of our ships, which should marginally increase their effective range.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIonDriveTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows the construction of improved hyperdrives.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIonDriveTech_Dec
StringTable.String: By using magnetic fields to capture ions from the interstellar medium during hyperdrive flight, we can funnel this additional mass into the exhaust of our conventional fusion engines, increasing the overall speed and efficiency of the propulsion system. We call these Ion Drives, and they make us go faster, basically.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIonOptimization1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases the speed of all ships.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIonOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: The ion capture technology of our Ion Drives requires a fiendish amount of tuning which our ship's engineers are only just learning to automate. Once this work is done, we should see slightly higher speeds across our fleet.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIonOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Hyperfield generators are no longer the rare pieces of equipment they once were, and we're beginning to see efficiencies of scale in the manufacture of them.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIonOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Every year our hyperdrives get more efficient and smaller. Less room for the engines means more room for everything else, benefiting every type of ship we could conceive of.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWarpFieldTheory_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows the construction of advanced hyperdrives.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWarpFieldTheory_Dec
StringTable.String: Our researchers are now able to "stack" up the space-bending fields of our hyperdrives, magnifying the acceleration effect. They call these stacked fields "Warp Fields" and are able to use them to create vastly more powerful engines.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWarpFieldFocus1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases the speed of all ships.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWarpFieldFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: By tuning the arrangement of stacked hyperfields in a variety of dimensions, we've found some surprisingly cheap ways to improve the speed of our Warp Drives.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWarpFieldFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we're using stacked fields and multi-field generators, even the most minuscule improvement in efficiency we find leads to significant cost savings.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWarpFieldFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: With a bit of experience working with the effects of stacked hyperfields, we've determined that we were stacking them inefficiently. Smaller field generators can achieve the same effects as their fatter predecessors.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHyperwarpWaves_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows the construction of exotic hyperdrives.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHyperwarpWaves_Dec
StringTable.String: A Hyperwarp Wave creates a cascading series of warp fields at a distance in front of the vessel, allowing the warp drive to effectively compress already compressed space. That glosses over a number of complicated mathematical issues which had to be sorted out to make it work, but our researchers now believe we can begin developing even faster drives.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHyperwarpMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: No other civilization in the galaxy can match ours for the efficiency and ease with which we build our drives.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHyperwarpMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: We have all but mastered hyperfield technology, and are capable of wringing the most possible speed from even the smallest engines.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersStellarFoldingTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate hyperdrives.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersStellarFoldingTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Stellar folding is the ultimate extension of hyperfield technology, bending space on a scale never seen before, with hyperfields approaching the diameter of a star. Our ships are now the fastest in the galaxy, and perhaps the fastest the galaxy has ever seen.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHyperfieldProjection_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of speed boosting support modules.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHyperfieldProjection_Dec
StringTable.String: Careful analysis of the way hyperfield waves interact when ships are travelling in formation has revealed the possibility of building larger field generators capable of increasing the drive efficiency of an entire fleet.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersGravityFieldManipulation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced speed boosting support modules.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersGravityFieldManipulation_Dec
StringTable.String: It took many decades of effort before our physicists were finally able to find the graviton. It turned out to be inside us the whole time. Inside of everything the whole time, to be technical. Anyways, having harnessed its power, we can now generate large artificial gravity fields, which should greatly increase the maneuverability and tactical options of our ships in combat.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHyperfieldDisruption_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of enemy speed reduction modules.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHyperfieldDisruption_Dec
StringTable.String: By analyzing the interference effects of multiple hyperwave fields from different ships travelling in close proximity, and combining that with our ability to generate hyperfield effects at ever increasing ranges, we can now limit the speed of enemy ships within the range of a properly equipped starbase.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersStellarFieldProjection_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced speed boosting support modules.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersStellarFieldProjection_Dec
StringTable.String: The Stellar Field Projector allows properly equipped ships to effectively "tow" ships with less capable drives. The same technology will help us improve the hyperfield enhancing capabilities of our Starbases.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInterstellarSurvey_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved sensors and survey modules.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInterstellarSurvey_Dec
StringTable.String: "Look before you leap," is excellent advice in all sorts of aspects of life and galactic civilization building. Now we finally have the tools to do just that.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSensorOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest generation of nano-processors allow us to more rapidly process the massive volumes of information our sensors return, improving the overall effectiveness of our sensor systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSensorOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: The hyperfield detectors which our sensors use were originally cobbled together from left over drives. Now that we have dedicated sensor manufacturing equipment, we can expect to see some significant cost savings.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSensorOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our earliest sensors were crude, jury-rigged things, and if we begin swapping out their parts for dedicated sensor-specific equipment, we should see significant weight savings.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEnergyFieldSensors_Dec
StringTable.String: We've long been able to detect the fields which all ships emit to control their hyperdrives. But improvements in our understanding of the effects of space folding have revealed that those fields are detectable at much greater distances than previously believed.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEnergyFieldFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our technicians have found that by turning one of the knobs up, our sensor systems can see a bit further. We feel kind of dumb for not realizing this before.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEnergyFieldFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Further refinements to our sensor manufacturing process has led to the production of cheaper, more efficient sensors. The accountants are all very excited.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEnergyFieldFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: The creation of high-density field detection components should lead to more compact sensors, leaving our ship designers more room to install guns. Everyone wins. Except the people the guns are pointed at.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSubspaceSensors_Dec
StringTable.String: Subspace is our term for the 12-dimension region of space which lies at right angles to and a little bit behind our universe. It's that place which is just permanently in the corner of your eye, and it took some very smart people a very long time to figure out a way to look at it. The upshot of all this is that it enables us to peer over much longer distances than ever before.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSensorMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: When a ragtag group of science-accountants teamed up with the goal of identifying cost savings in our most advanced sensor systems, few believed they had a chance. Many openly mocked them. Some people spit on them. But somehow, despite all odds, they managed it. And we will all reap the benefits.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSensorMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: A careful analysis of the latest generation of sensor systems has revealed that several of their components don't technically have to exist in this universe. By shifting their workload into another plane, we can reduce the amount of mass we have to lug around in ours.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersTargetingAssistTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of targeting and stealth modules.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersTargetingAssistTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Study of how our ships have performed (and occasionally underperformed) in combat have led to a number of improvements in our tactical targeting systems. At the same time, we've devised a system which should confuse enemy sensors, for even greater tactical benefit.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersTargetingSupport_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of targeting and jamming modules.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersTargetingSupport_Dec
StringTable.String: We've adapted our tactical sensor improvements into support modules, capable of allowing a single ship to provide the same sensor accuracy and jamming benefits to an entire fleet of vessels.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLifeSupport_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved life support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLifeSupport_Dec
StringTable.String: It seems surprising that the factor limiting the travel range for most ships is its life support system, but there you have it. For anything less than a colony ship, keeping the occupants alive is now a bigger challenge than keeping the engines fueled.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLifeSupportOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our experience with the rigors of space travel, and the shrieked radio transmissions of the few who fell to the rigors of space travel, have revealed a number of small improvements we might be able to make to our existing life support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLifeSupportOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Reducing the cost of building life support systems is one of those necessary things we have to do that we don't want to advertise too much. It's hard enough finding naval recruits as it is.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLifeSupportOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: By minimizing the amount of weight and space our life support systems take up, we leave more room for our life reduction systems, which is what we're now calling guns.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSupportFieldGeneration_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced life support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSupportFieldGeneration_Dec
StringTable.String: Our growing familiarity with various force field technologies has enabled us to replace our primitive mechanical life support systems with more elegant field based processors. Food is now stored in a single block of nutrient-rich sludge, which should greatly reduce spoilage, as well as the need for utensils, as the fields pipe it directly into the user's mouth.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSupportFieldFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: It turns out that by aerating the nutrient sludge we provide our crews it takes up significantly more volume in their stomachs, making them feel full with less food. There are some associated problems with, uh, gas, but we're coming up with special filters to address that.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSupportFieldFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our life support systems are now really, really cheap. Still effective though, let's not forget that. Maybe let's not even call them cheap. "Economical," or "Value," maybe.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSupportFieldFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: By using the latest generation of efficient field generators, and putting our crews on a diet, we've been able to reduce the mass of our life support systems even more.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPromethionSupportSystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic life support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPromethionSupportSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: The Promethion Support System is the logical extension of our support field technologies, with all the requirements for a living organism - oxygen, water, and food - now piped directly into that organism rather than left to float around and get on the equipment.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLifeSupportMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Some of the crews are finding out how little we're spending on their life support systems. "Do you think we're worthless?" they shout. And we don't, we really don't. They're not worthless at all! Worth less, yes. But that's different.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLifeSupportMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: We've figured out how to coax nutrient sludge to deliver itself to the crew using embedded Promethion field effectors, saving us the weight of carrying around heavy fixed effectors. And the embedded effectors come right out in the waste stream, ready for reuse!

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLosslessSupportSystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate life support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLosslessSupportSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: Our life support systems are now close to perfect, wasting no resources whatsoever, and recycling essentially all generated waste products. As an added bonus, the experience of being surrounded and penetrated by deeply personal fields is now much less humiliating for the crew.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSupportFieldMastery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of fleet life support modules.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSupportFieldMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Our switch to field based life support systems has revealed the possibility of offloading partial life support requirements to other vessels. Additionally, the minimization of food requirements makes it now possible to supplement fleet range via unmanned supply probes launched from an appropriately equipped facility.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersExplorationExtention_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced fleet life support modules.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersExplorationExtention_Dec
StringTable.String: We've adapted the latest in Promethion support field technology to be used by our fleet-support vessals, increasing a fleet's total potential travel range. Additionally, we've made significant improvements to our starbase life support extension modules.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersOrbitalManufacturing_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved manufacturing buildings, and small hulls.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersOrbitalManufacturing_Dec
StringTable.String: Moving our ship construction operations to micro-gravity environments will eventually allow for the construction of massive structures. We're not quite there yet, but this, the first step out of the well, was always going to be the biggest.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersOrbitalSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: It turns out that you can't just put anyone in a space suit and get them to build things in orbit, because a huge majority of people don't understand what an orbit is. Some improved training programs should dramatically improve our orbital manufacturing capability.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersOrbitalSpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Orbital plane change maneuvers are expensive, and something we want to avoid if we can. Getting material to the right orbit when it needs to be there is a huge challenge which we're only just coming to grips with.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersOrbitalSpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Ironically enough, space is at a premium in space, inside of our hulls at least. Even small improvements in packing efficiencies are worth the effort of hunting them down.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersZeroGravityConstruction_Dec
StringTable.String: Most of our initial attempts at building structures in micro-gravity environments were clumsy variations of ground-based techniques, not far removed from banging rocks together. Now we have the expertise to design and implement true zero-gravity construction practices, opening the door to a whole new scale of vessels.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersZeroGravityOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: After donating a few hulls for weapons practice, we were able to see the structural damage inflicted on them, we identify structural reinforcements that should toughen each ship substantially.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersZeroGravityOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Worksite planning in an orbital environment is a seriously complicated business, but now that we've got the hang of it, we should see significant cost savings for every hull we construct.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersZeroGravityOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our new zero gravity construction program has enabled us to build hollow structural elements which are still able to handle very high compression loads. By maximizing the use of these, and routing various ancillary ship systems through the cavities, we can save space for mission critical equipment.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLargeScaleConstruction_Dec
StringTable.String: Building larger space ship hulls requires a lot more than just adding more stuff to them. Just ensuring that they won't collapse on themselves under acceleration is a serious challenge. Seating arrangements are another key factor, so that the crew doesn't collapse in on themselves under acceleration.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersOrbitalConstructionFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: It seems counter-intuitive, but by introducing very small weaknesses in the molecular structure of our hulls, we can make them deformable in very controllable ways, which makes them quite a bit more resilient.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersOrbitalConstructionFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest generation of self-propelled manufacturing equipment allows our worker to maneuver inside of hulls with more ease than ever before, reducing the challenge and expense of construction.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersOrbitalConstructionFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: As our hulls grew ever larger, we began to lose some of the art of packing that our predecessors had. But now thanks to the scale of our ships, even very small improvements in packing can lead to much more room for everything else.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersMassiveScaleConstruction_Dec
StringTable.String: We're building some of the largest ships this galaxy has ever seen, capable of blotting out the stars. Obviously any ship can blot out the stars if you get close enough to it. You just don't have to get very close to these ones for that to be the case. Nor would you want to.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHullMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: That we build the best ships in the galaxy is undeniable, but that we do it so economically is what's really impressive. Our enemies have never been menaced so thriftily.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHullMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Thanks to advances in the field of bristling, never before have our ships been so bristling with weapons. They could also bristle with other things we suppose. Your choice.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHullStrengthening_Dec
StringTable.String: Using new force field technologies, we've been able to embed strengthening fields within the structures of our vessels, making them substantially more resistant to damage. They also now tingle if you lick them.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHullRepairSystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of hull support and repair modules.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHullRepairSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: The same field technology we use to strength our ships can be used to conduct partial repairs to them as well, straightening and reinforcing battle-damaged structural elements.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSelfHealingHulls_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of tactical repair modules.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSelfHealingHulls_Dec
StringTable.String: Tiny little self-replicating nanobots are capable of almost anything so long as you don't ask too many questions about them. By installing nanobot repair modules in our ships and starbases, our ships will be able to repair damage during battle itself.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersCarrierTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Carrier based combat allows us to bring many weapons to bear on an enemy from multiple vectors, while keeping our larger capital ships further from the danger. Fighters are a lot more replaceable than capital ships, and there's no shortage of volunteers to fly them. Apparently there's something glamorous about being vaporized in a very small ship.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersCarrierFocus1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows for the construction of cheap and light Interceptor Drones

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersCarrierFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: These little drones are fast and deadly, and more importantly cheap. They also have the added advantage of not requiring a crew, which saves lives.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersCarrierFocus2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows for the construction of cheap and light Guardian Drones.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersCarrierFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: These tuff little drones will guard our Support and Capital ships to the end, and when they are destroyed, no lives are lost.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHighCapacityCarriers_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of high capacity carrier modules.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHighCapacityCarriers_Dec
StringTable.String: Thanks to our latest generation of fighters, designed to be more compact and packable, along with more efficient repair, reloading, and recovery facilities, we've been able to greatly improve the carrying capacity of our carriers.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInterstellarLogistics_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of mining facilities. Increases Logistics.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInterstellarLogistics_Dec
StringTable.String: It's one thing to build a ship, it's another thing to keep it running. Whether it's keeping it supplied with fuel, ammunition, or people, there is an awful lot going on behind the scenes to keep a deep-space vessel operational. None of this is exciting of course. Logistics officers are some of the most boring people you're ever likely to meet. But a necessary evil.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLogisticalOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we have a little more practice moving assets around in space, and figured out some of the issues relativistic travel creates with our timekeeping and administration, we've been able to significantly improve our logistical capacity.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLogisticalOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: An asteroid mining operation is a ballet of activity, as boring machines, ore haulers, and repair drones swarm about an asteroid. Keeping these pieces moving is challenging, and improving the organization is a sure way to improve its output.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLogisticalOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Shipyards are, by some measures, the most complicated constructs we have ever created. Any improvements we can make to their management and operations will result in significant cost savings.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersFleetLogisticsTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Scaling up our naval operations to include large multi-vessel fleets has created a number of additional logistical challenges which we're only just now coming to grips with. We'll definitely stop sending ships out without oxygen now though.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDeepSpaceLogistics_Dec
StringTable.String: Whether it's via unmanned probes, deep space caches, or our network of merchant vessals, keeping our fleets well stocked while our civilization ever expands has proven to be a tremendous, but still very boring, challenge.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersGalacticLogistics_Dec
StringTable.String: Our mastery of mass-scale logistics is the envy of the galaxy. Well. The part of the galaxy which gets excited about logistics that is.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWarfareTech_Dec
StringTable.String: We can't be naive about what we might find in the galaxy. Or who. From this point on, our ships must be armed, whether to protect against some yet unseen enemy, or even ourselves.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWeaponsSystemsTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of basic weapon systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWeaponsSystemsTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The best defense is a good offense. Interestingly, so is the best offense. With that in mind, we've developed a number of weapon systems which should prove very well suited to space-based defense. And, as discussed, offense.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWeaponsSpecializationTech1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases the Accuracy of all weapon systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWeaponsSpecializationTech1_Dec
StringTable.String: We have increased the targeting systems of our existing weapons substantially, and what we have learned will apply to future weapons systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWeaponsSpecializationTech2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces the Mass of all weapons systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWeaponsSpecializationTech2_Dec
StringTable.String: We have reduced the mass of our existing weapons systems, and what we have learned will apply to future weapons as well.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWeaponsSpecializationTech3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces the Cost of all weapons systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWeaponsSpecializationTech3_Dec
StringTable.String: We have reduced the cost of our existing weapons systems, and what we have learned will apply to future weapons as well.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBeamWeapons_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved beam weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBeamWeapons_Dec
StringTable.String: Whether energy, particles, or both at the same time, there's an awful lot of destructive potential in suddenly sending a lot of them all at one place.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBeamWeaponOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: A new generation of the ultra transparent materials we use in our focusing crystals has made it possible to increase the damage potential of our beam weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBeamWeaponOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Beam weapons will never be cheap, but some economies of scale have led to price reductions in the magnification and focusing equipment these weapons rely upon.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBeamWeaponOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Lacking the requirements for ammunition storage, beam weapons have always been mass-efficient. And after some hard work by the boys and girls in the lab, now they're more so.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersMatterDisruption_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced beam weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersMatterDisruption_Dec
StringTable.String: Our researchers have been able to weaponize a columnated beam of particles capable of disrupting the strong nuclear force, severing the bonds which hold the nucleus together, turning matter into smaller chunks of matter.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHighEnergyFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Advances in crystallography have created a new generation of focusing crystals capable of handling much greater quantities of energy without fracturing. All of our beam weapons just got a little bit badder.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHighEnergyFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: For a long time the manufacture of beam weapons was as much art as science, requiring highly trained technicians to individually polish and tune each weapon. By making concentrated efforts to standardize beam weapon manufacturing, we're finally able to automate portions of it, reducing the cost of each unit.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHighEnergyFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: The heaviest parts of beam weapons has always been the charge coils and their associated cooling equipment. But with the latest generation of super-conductors we can now build these smaller and more compact than ever.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPlasmaProjection_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic beam weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPlasmaProjection_Dec
StringTable.String: Thanks to a breakthrough in containment technology, we're now able to generate columnated plasma containment fields at incredible distances. The upshot to this is that we can now send massive quantities of plasma at relativistic velocities in the direction of anything we don't like very much.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBeamWeaponMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our supply chain for the creation of plasma containment fields had a couple of kinks that needed to get worked out, but now that we have, we expect to be able to create beam weapons for far less resources.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBeamWeaponMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: We're now able to push our beam weapons right up to the limits that physics allow. If we want any more power per unit of mass, we may have to move to a different universe.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEnergyPhasing_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of devastating beam weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEnergyPhasing_Dec
StringTable.String: The synthesis of the phaser particle is almost impossible to understand if you don't have several advanced degrees and possibly an extra brain. Suffice to say, by sending a modest quantity of these particles at the enemy, we can induce a chain reaction which breaks matter down into ghostly neutrinos, effectively evaporating it. This is vicious, nasty staff we're working with now, so please be good with it.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDoomRayTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate beam weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDoomRayTech_Dec
StringTable.String: An adaptation of the phaser particle emitter has resulted in massive improvements in the induced matter-breakdown reaction, making it effective against even the highest density armor. Also of note, our scientists are pretty sure the reaction won't consume the entire universe, so feel free to continue deploying it as you see fit.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBeamWeaponAugmentation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of beam support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBeamWeaponAugmentation_Dec
StringTable.String: Our beam weapons use a variety of systems to accumulate energy prior to the weapon firing. We've found that the capacity of these energy storage systems can be augmented by an external field, which although expensive, allows for increased beam output. Most interestingly, such fields can be theoretically projected at great distances, potentially improving the beam output of an entire fleet.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHighEnergyTransfer_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved beam support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHighEnergyTransfer_Dec
StringTable.String: After considerable study in the way that our beam weapons interact on a subatomic level with both shield systems and hulls, we've developed systems capable of reducing the effectiveness of enemy shields, or absorbing enemy beam attacks on our own vessels.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHighEnergyMagnification_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced beam support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHighEnergyMagnification_Dec
StringTable.String: An improved understanding of the effects our beam augmentation fields have has resulted in the possibility of even greater beam outputs. Our beam weapons have that funny smell again, but we don't hear many crew members complaining.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersMissileWeapons_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved missile weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersMissileWeapons_Dec
StringTable.String: Conceptually simple, though there's no shame in that, missile-based weapons provide a tremendous amount of punch for their cost.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersMissileOptimization1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases firing speed of missile weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersMissileOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our weapons engineers have determined that shooting more missiles at things makes them blow up faster. Which seems obvious in retrospect. Anyways, our missile launchers shoot more now.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersMissileOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Missiles were always going to be the most cost-effective means of making things hurt, and now they're a little bit more so.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersMissileOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Reviews of training data and engagement encounters reveals one overriding request from the field. "We want more missiles. Give us more missiles." Well, having reduced the mass of our launchers and ammunition racks, we're now able to do just that.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHarpoonTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced missile weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHarpoonTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The Harpoon class of missiles employ a number of improvements in speed, range, tracking, and warhead yield, resulting in our most powerful conventional missile system yet.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWarheadFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: More target drones have given their lives for our glory, and a careful analysis of their deaths has revealed some exciting possibilities in the field of shaped charges, which should improve the destructive yield of our warheads.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWarheadFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: The most delicate part of missile manufacturing was the warhead, for obvious reasons. But the latest generation of ultra-stable exposives should reduce both manufacturing costs and workplace accidents significantly.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWarheadFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: By using the latest generation of shaped-charge warheads to reduce the weight of each individual missile, with no corresponding loss of destructive power, we can make room for more missile launchers in total.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPhotonicWarheads_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic missile weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPhotonicWarheads_Dec
StringTable.String: One of the biggest downsides to missile based technology is that much of the energy is expended on the outer surface of enemy vessels. By including with our warheads a device which releases a high energy burst of photons at the moment of impact, we can achieve substantial penetration against both armor and shield systems, greatly increasing the destructive potential of our warheads.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPayloadMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our missile manufacturing facilities are now almost perfectly efficient, wasting no material whatsoever. Destruction shouldn't come so cheap, yet here we are.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPayloadMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: Modeling of the subatomic interactions our warheads make upon detonation against various hull and shield systems have revealed the possibility of making lighter, more efficient warheads.c

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPhotonTorpedos_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of devestating missile weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPhotonTorpedos_Dec
StringTable.String: By matching a wide-spectrum version of the photon-encasement armor piercing technology with our latest anti-matter warheads, we've created a weapon with truly colossal damage potential. They glow a new color too.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersNightmareTorpedoTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate missile weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersNightmareTorpedoTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The Nightmare torpedo contains a tiny singularity trapped in a pocket universe until the moment of impact, which upon being released causes horrifying damage to anything foolish enough to be standing by a place we're firing something called Nightmare torpedos at.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersMissileAugmentation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of missile support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersMissileAugmentation_Dec
StringTable.String: Our weapons researchers have come up with a number of ship or starbase based sensor systems which can improve the tracking, and ultimately the range of our missiles.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersAdvancedMissileGuidance_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved missile support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersAdvancedMissileGuidance_Dec
StringTable.String: Improved decoy and adaptive camoflauge systems have greatly increased the survivavbility of our missiles when faced with point defense systems. And our ship and starbase based guidance systems now feature a number of predictive systems, allowing for more efficient missile flight paths which should help boost their range.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIntelligentWarheads_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced missile support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIntelligentWarheads_Dec
StringTable.String: Cluster warheads are capable of overwhelming and neutralizing enemy point defense systems. And our fleet-based guidance systems, along with the latest generation of information-sharing "pilot" missiles, will allow for even more efficient guidance and improved range.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticWeapons_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved kinetic weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticWeapons_Dec
StringTable.String: There's just something nice and honest about a projectile, isn't there? And thanks to a little help from teams of massive electromagnets, we've now got some extremely fast projectiles to work with.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: A switch to slightly smaller projectiles, along with improved energy delivery systems, has led to significant improvements in the speed of each projectile, and thus the effective range of each unit.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Never before have we needed to make electromagnetic coils in such quantities, and the early days of kinetic weapons were plagued by supply-chain problems. But supply has finally ramped up to meet demand, and we should see cost savings across all associated kinetic weapons programs.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Some experimentation with the winding patterns of our electromagnetic coils has revealed a number of subtle synergistic effects which we can take advantage of, leading to tighter, more compact coils, and ultimately, lower mass weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPulseCannonTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced kinetic weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPulseCannonTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Research efforts to emit tight clusters of particles at rapid velocities have led to a weapon which gets around some of the practical limitations of slug based mass drivers. Called pulse cannons, they have similar tactical characteristics as previous generations of kinetic weapons. They're just much more powerful.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticAccelerationFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest generation of superconductors have enabled us to deliver energy to our weapon systems much more rapidly. The trade off is smaller projectiles, though as they'll be launched at higher velocities, the destructive potential will be similiar, and the weapons will have a much longer effective range.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticAccelerationFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest generation of superconducting electromagnetic coils, and their less-strenuous cooling requirements, make them much less fragile to handle. We expect to see significant cost savings now that we won't break as many during production.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticAccelerationFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our new ultra-low resistance electromagnets generate a lot more kick per unit weight, leading to lower mass accelerators. So feel free to cram more of them into whatever you're cramming them into.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersGravitonThrower_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic kinetic weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersGravitonThrower_Dec
StringTable.String: By synthesizing and launching pulses of gravitons at the enemy, we can induce massive shifts in the local gravity of the ship systems they strike. This will cause incredible amounts of damage, and probably make anyone standing nearby feel really dizzy. Before they die.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: "We Make Kinetic Weapons Faster," is probably the dumbest slogan ever conceived of, but the factory workers seem really proud of it, so no-one had the heart to tell them. And to be fair, they do make them really quite quickly now.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our scientists have all but mastered kinetic weapons, and are approaching the limits of the field, making them as mass efficient as theoretically possible.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersQuantumDrivers_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of devestating kinetic weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersQuantumDrivers_Dec
StringTable.String: Quantum drivers fire shells which contain small quantum fields which, on impact, pull in a tremendous amount of mass from a neighboring dimension. We're not sure which dimension and can only hope that they didn't need that mass.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSingularityDrivers_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate kinetic weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSingularityDrivers_Dec
StringTable.String: The pinnacle of kinetic weapon technology, these launch micro singularities that collapse into existance shortly after impact. These are bad news, the worst news really, for anyone who can't get out of the way.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticAugmentation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of kinetic support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticAugmentation_Dec
StringTable.String: Inertial dampening should be impossible in this universe, which is why we were a little surprised we were able to pull it off. We've used this stroke of luck to create systems which can boost the velocity and effective range of our kinetic weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersMassManipulation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved kinetic support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersMassManipulation_Dec
StringTable.String: We've modified our intertial modification technology to actually fit inside the projectiles, which are now capable of generating ultra-dense outer surfaces for a brief period, adding massive armor penetrating capabilities. Additionally, we've made improvements to our fleetwide inertial modification systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInertialMagnification_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced kinetic support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInertialMagnification_Dec
StringTable.String: Our inertial modifying projectiles are now capable of attacking the enemy's armor directly, creating low density fissures throughout it, causing the whole structure to splinter if struck properly. Additionally our fleetwide inertial modifying systems have been more or less perfected, subjecting anything which menaces one of our fleets with the prospect of facing a deadly hailstorm. Of death.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDefenseSystemTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of basic defensive systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDefenseSystemTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Naval officers are notoriously squishy, and otherwise difficult to protect in a ship that operates in hard vacuum. But we've got to try, otherwise the squishy officers will stop getting in to the ships.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDefensiveSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Deflecting or diffusing incoming weapon fire is really, really hard, and we're far from having a really good understanding of it. Our latest round of research has only succeeded in making existing systems a bit cheaper to build.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDefensiveSpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Making our point defenses fire more crap into the space around the ship is a simple solution to a complicated question. Though a surprisingly effective one.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDefensiveSpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: By adjusting the size and positioning of our armor panels, we've been able to minimize overlap and other inefficiencies, and can now provide the same level of protection to our ships for less overall weight.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersShieldSystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved shield systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersShieldSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: No longer must our ships cower behind crude deflector fields. The latest generation of shields, although expensive, are capable of stopping incoming attacks outright, rather than just deflecting or diffusing their impact.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersShieldOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Of all the suggestions we've received from the field on how to improve our shield systems, "Please make them bigger," seemed to be their most common. So we've done that.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersShieldOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: We probably shouldn't talk in front of the troops about our efforts to make our shield systems cheaper, even if it means more shields to go around for everyone. Because that's not how they'll see it.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersShieldOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: The first few generation of field emitters used in our shield systems were incredibly bulky and cumbersome. And they still are, frankly. Just a bit less so now.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBarrierFieldGeneration_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced shield systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBarrierFieldGeneration_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest generation of shielding technology, the so called Barrier Field, provides a number of improvements over previous systems. Now capable of absorbing a portion of the energy which strikes it, this dramatically increases the energy efficiency of the system, allowing for ultimately much more powerful shields.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBarrierSystemFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: The first generation of energy absorbers in our Barrier Field systems used a model of capacitor which occasionally exploded violently. Crews had decidedly mixed feelings about this, so we replaced those capacitors with a slightly more robust model.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBarrierSystemFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: After the first few prototypes went out the door, we've been able to achieve some economies of scale in the manufacture of our Barrier Field systems, reducing the cost of shield components.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBarrierSystemFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: We've recently been able to shave a ton of weight off our shield generators thanks to the latest generation of superconductors and their less extensive cooling requirements.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersForceFieldTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic shield systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersForceFieldTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest generation of shields are capable of directing vast amounts of additional energy to a specific section of shields within nanoseconds of the moment of impact, allowing for shields which are much stronger relative to their respective weight.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersShieldMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Cheaper shields never meant less effective shields, and it's only taken a few decades for our troops to finally understand that. Which is good, because our shields are spectacularly cheap now.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersShieldMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: It's impossible to make the energy emitters of our shields any denser, our engineers now claim. They claim that kind of thing a lot and always take it back later, but they seem pretty sure this time.c

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInvulnerabilityTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate shield systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInvulnerabilityTech_Dec
StringTable.String: "Invulnerable" may be a bit of an exaggeration. Our researchers allow that some theoretical weapons could penetrate these shields. But those would be some pretty terrifying weapons, and even then you'd rather be behind this shield than not.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersShieldSupportSystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of shield support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersShieldSupportSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: Advances in the focusing capabilities of our shield generators has given us the ability to generate and augment shields at a distance. This should provide massive tactical and strategic options for fleet operations.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersShieldAugmentation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved shield support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersShieldAugmentation_Dec
StringTable.String: The same technology we've used to generate shields at a distance can now be done with our Barrier Field systems, allowing for even greater improvements in fleet survivability.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEnergyFieldManipulation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced shield support systems.
