StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEnergyFieldManipulation_Dec
StringTable.String: Our mastery of the energy fields needed to create and maintain shields has resulted in a couple interesting new technologies, capable of interfering with enemy shield systems, or massively shielding friendly units within range.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPointDefenses_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPointDefenses_Dec
StringTable.String: An array of tiny computer controlled railguns that track and destroy incoming missiles, point defense systems are unparalleled at protecting ships and starbases from missile attacks, though still aren't terribly helpful at defending against other classes of weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPointDefenseOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: A careful analysis of various missile performance envelopes has led us to adjust the firing patterns of our point defense systems, which should make them more effective.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPointDefenseOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: The sensor and tracking equipment our point defense systems use are fairly specialized pieces of equipment that were initially quite rare and costly. Now that we've dedicated a lot of effort to building point defenses, the price of those systems is starting to come down.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPointDefenseOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: The slugs fired by point defenses don't need to be large, and were limited by the fact that we could only build railguns so small. But now that we can build more compact railguns, we should see significant weight savings for all our point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersCounterMeasures_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersCounterMeasures_Dec
StringTable.String: By deploying electronic counter measures which interfere with and confuse incoming missile attacks, we've greatly increased the survivability of our ships and starbases. Against missiles at least. Hard to confuse a laser.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersCounterMeasureFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: There's always a generational game of leap frog being played between missile designers and ECM designers, but we believe our latest algorithims have given us the leg up on the bad guys this time.c

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersCounterMeasureFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our earliest attempts at ECM suites were heavily customizable, requiring a great deal of hand tuning to get to perform. Now that we know what works, we can automate much more of the manufacturing and installation process.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersCounterMeasureFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our first ECM suites were cobbled together from a half dozen different processors and transmitters. We've since streamlined those into a single unit which weighs much less.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDroneSentrySystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDroneSentrySystems_Dec
StringTable.String: By installing our point defense systems on drone platforms that orbit our ships at a distance, we add a valuable extra layer of protection against missile attacks.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDroneSystemMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: To be fair, only a few of our drone systems have ever actually shot each other in combat situations. But by minimizing that just a little more, we should be able to make our point defenses a little more cost-effective, albeit less funny.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDroneSystemMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: Once we realized point defense drones don't need much personal space, we were able to start packing them in a lot tighter.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArreonMissileDefenseTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArreonMissileDefenseTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The ultimate in point defense technology, featuring the latest generation of micro-drones, armed with railguns, ECM and smart chafe, capable of filling the space around a ship with a cloud of debris so thick no enemy missiles are likely to survive.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPointDefenseSupportSystem_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of point defense support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPointDefenseSupportSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: Our experience working with small scale point defenses has led to a type of long range missile tracking system which should enhance the point defense capabilities of an entire fleet.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPointDefenseAugmentation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved point defense support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPointDefenseAugmentation_Dec
StringTable.String: Wide area missile disruptors enhance the effectiveness of our existing counter measures, adding a much needed layer of extra missile security to entire fleets.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPointDefenseManipulation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced point defense support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPointDefenseManipulation_Dec
StringTable.String: Our mastery of point defense technologies has led to the development of fleet-wide drone systems. Additionally, our fleets can now be equipped with point defense disruptors, essentially a type of counter-counter-measure, which should greatly boost the effectiveness of our own missile attacks.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorSystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved armor systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: A big lump of ultra-dense material remains an effective, if unsubtle, method of protection from modern space-based weaponry.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: A simple mistake by one of our fabricators resulted in a set of armor panels marginally denser and more resilient than we'd seen before. It took us a long time to replicate that mistake, but now that we have, our ships should be a little tougher to kill.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: One of the biggest challenges with armor manufacturing was simply the logistics of moving rare and heavy resources and materials around. Now that we've got our supply chain sorted out, we can expect to see some nice cost savings.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: By its very nature, armor is always going to be a fairly mass-intensive way of protection. That said, we can do a few things to improve the precision and fit of armor plating, which should cut down on weight a bit.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDurantiumCompositeTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced armor systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDurantiumCompositeTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Experminents have revealed that when certain materials are stacked in specific arrangements, they have a synergistic effect on the strength of their neighbors when exposed to compressive forces, which greatly magnifiess their damage absorption potential. We call these new composites Durantium, and they should tremendously increase the survivability of our ships.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: A careful study of some battle-damaged ships has revealed previously unknown weaknesses in our armor systems. Basically, we know why some of them were cracking in half now. We'll do something about that right away.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: If the troops ask, it's not that our armor is now cheap. It's that we've found a more efficient way of manufacturing it. But yes, it is pretty cheap.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Some experiments with the arrangement of our Durantium composites has revealed that we can get away with slightly lense dense materials at certain layers with no impact to the armor's effectiveness.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKanviumLaminateTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic armor systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKanviumLaminateTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Kanvium armor systems use a new type of lamination which, upon impact, causes surrounding materials to partially fluidize, deforming to absorb energy, but in a recoverable way. Impacts are spread out over a much larger area, increasing the effectiveness of the armor. After the impact, the armor flows back into its original shape, minimizing the risk posed by repeat hits.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: With modern armoring systems, the design of the armor informs the shape of the ship as much as the other way around, and properly armoring a ship is a complicated trade off between armoror and ship designer. It's an art essentially, and it's one that we have mastered.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: We've created and shredded countless generations of armor, and worn out entire test ranges with our target practice. On a weight basis, our armor systems are now as efficient as they can possibly be.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersZeroPointArmorTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate armor systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersZeroPointArmorTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Zero point armor is a thin layer of a material we have a hard time proving exists, only knowing of it by the effect that it has. Upon impact, it appears to essentially tap into the zero-point energy of the surrounding quantum vacuum, directing all that energy to repulse any incoming projectiles. It's almost impossibly tough, we can prove that much at least.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorSupportSystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of armor support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorSupportSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: In the factory, we've begun producing armor plating with a variety of force field based technologies. By adapting some of those into long-range ship-based emitters, we're able to create a hardening effect in material at a considerable distance. This technology could be used to make every ship in a fleet substantially more durable.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorEnhancement_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved armor support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorEnhancement_Dec
StringTable.String: The fields that we use to generate hardening effects at a distance have twenty seven different "poles" which can be cycled repeatedly through, changing the alignment of the hardening effects in the affected material, generating substantially stronger, more resiliant materials.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIntegrityFieldProjection_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced armor support systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIntegrityFieldProjection_Dec
StringTable.String: Our latest generation of armoring fields no longer just generate hardening effects at a distance, but can now induce material fluidization and shape recovery effects as well. These new Integrity Fields can make every ship in a fleet invulnerable to all but the most powerful attacks.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersCommunicationsTech_Dec
StringTable.String: We've already seen glimpses of evidence that we're not alone in this galaxy. This presents an incredible danger to us, but also perhaps an opportunity. But also, let's stress again, danger.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIndustrialSpecialization_Dec
StringTable.String: It only took a few horrific accidents for us to finally come to grips with the challenges of off-world industry, and now that we have, we've identified a number of ways we can begin improving and specializing our industrial capacity.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersConstructionOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: Seemingly small improvements can have a big effect when applied to large projects, and we're working on some very large projects now indeed.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersManufacturingFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: There's no getting around it: "Incremental improvements in manufacturing techniques" isn't much of a headline. Which is a shame, considering the benefit we expect to see from them.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIndustrialMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: If it can be dreamed up, we can build it. Indeed, many of our economists now believe that the limiting factor of our industrial capacity is our own imaginations.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersResearchOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: Researchers are great at inventing things, but surprisingly bad at the business of inventing things. A number of inefficient practices have developed which we should be able to streamline.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersTechnologicalFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: The lab equipment needed to research some of these new fields is incredibly expensive and esoteric. Specializing our research efforts will be necessary to make the biggest advances.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPlanetarySpecialization_Dec
StringTable.String: We've made great strides with our colonization techniques in the past few years, and can now begin considering specific areas we'd like to improve upon.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersAgriculturalOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: Optimizing our farming processes will lead to a number of benefits which will help our civilization for a very long time. Until people stop needing food, really.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersFarmingFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: Although all this attention we pay to improving our farming techniques sometimes make our farmers uncomfortable - they do get set in their ways - the improvements to our food production capacity are too great to ignore.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersAgriculturalMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Our farms now provide an almost unlimited bounty, the food doing much of the hard work itself. The first time you see a plant or animal self-harvest is a little grim though, and school field trips have gotten harder.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersColonizationFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: Mastering living on an extreme world will make life there a lot more tolerable for the poor fools who volunteered for it.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBiospherePerfection_Dec
StringTable.String: No longer must our colonists die without cause. Even the deadliest of planets are now perfectly surviable to us.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersInterstellarSpecialization_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we have a bit of experience sending ships out into the darkness and having most of them come back, we've come up with a number of ways to improve our equipment and navigational techniques.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersIonOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we've seen them in wide-scale use, we've identified a number of ways we can make our new Ion Drive systems more efficient.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWarpFieldFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: Warp field technology is incredibly complicated, and has in more than a few cases, caused a researcher's brains to melt a little bit. But now that we have some experience working with them, we've identified a number of ways to improve their design.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHyperwarpMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Our ships are the envy of the galaxy, and our engineers heralded as heroes wherever they go. Fortunately they don't like going out much.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSensorOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: A concentrated effort to optimize our sensor systems could lead to a number of different improvements.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersEnergyFieldFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: As is usually the case when equipment is sent to the field, the technicians who actually use it soon came up with a number of different ways to improve its efficiency and effectiveness.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSensorMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: We don't anticipate any further increases in the viewing range of our sensors, not until we leave this universe for another one. But we can certainly make them a little more efficient.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLifeSupportOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: Everyone in the navy is very excited that we're trying to optimize our life support systems, and would certainly cheer if they weren't conserving their air.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersSupportFieldFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: Our early attempts at building field-based life support systems left behind many messes and many possible opportunities for improvement, which we're starting to identify now.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLifeSupportMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: We have all but mastered direct-nutrient injection technologies, and are wringing out a few additional efficiencies to reduce equipment size and cost.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersOrbitalSpecialization_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we've watched a few construction projects accidentally collapse on themselves in orbit, we've identified a number of possible improvements in our existing construction techniques.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersZeroGravityOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: We took a big step forward with our most recent switch to zero-gravity construction practices, and after a few trial runs and one teensy little accident, our engineers have identified a number of areas for improvement.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersOrbitalConstructionFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: We're getting better and better at large scale construction with every passing day, and a number of more efficient design practices are beginning to show up on our engineers' drawing tables. Along with the pretty offensive doodles which have always been there.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHullMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Our shipyards are already the envy of the civilized galaxy. But however great they are, they're still capable of more.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersCarrierFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: There's nothing like doing something a few times to see how much better it could be. A number of efficiencies in how we conduct our carrier operations have been made clear to us.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersLogisticalOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: A new generation of space accountants are becoming trained as we speak, capable of finding efficiencies and boring workers in any industry we choose.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWeaponsSpecialization_Dec
StringTable.String: By dedicating their efforts on a specific field of weapons technology, our researchers believe they can deliver a number of more effiicent weapon systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBeamWeaponOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: Weapons researchers have to keep paces with advances in many other fields to get the most out of their inventions. Right now, recent advances in material sciences are opening the door to a new generation of more efficient weapons.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersHighEnergyFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: A careful analysis of data returned from the field has revealed a number of inefficiencies which we can begin addressing in the next generation of our beam systems. We may also finally be able to get rid of that funny smell they make too.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBeamWeaponMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: We're now able to push our beam weapons right up to the limits that physics allow. If we want any more power, we may have to move to a different universe.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersMissileOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: After blowing up several thousand target drones and one unfortunate asteroid, our weapons engineers have come up with a number of possible improvements we can implement for our missile platforms.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersWarheadFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: We've spent comparatively little research time on the warhead components of our missile systems, but now that we've turned our attention to the matter, a number of possible efficiencies should be able to be gained with a little effort.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPayloadMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Various physical limits of this particular universe prevent us from wringing more destructive potential out of this generation of warheads. But we can certainly make them cheaper and lighter.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: Some modest improvements in the energy delivery systems of our kinetic weapons could result in improvements to the cost, mass, or even the range of each unit.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticAccelerationFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: Recent advances in superconducting technology should lead to improvements in the critical energy delivery systems of our kinetic weapons.c

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersKineticMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: After several generations of whipping things at other things as fast as possible, our scientists are now really quite goood at it. There remain but a few small efficiencies to wring out of the field.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDefensiveSpecialization_Dec
StringTable.String: Tasked with improving the survivability of our naval officers in combat situations, our engineer's first solution: "Don't enter combat situations," was less than helpful. So, after studying the wreckage of a few vessels we've lost in combat, they've come up with a number of possible improvements we can make in our defensive technologies.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersShieldOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: We've received quite a bit of useful data on real world performance of our shield systems, and have devised several possible improvements we can begin making to them.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersBarrierSystemFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: A careful design review of our initial implementation of the Barrier Field system has revealed a number of possible avenues for further improvements. Who says design reviews are unexciting?

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersShieldMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Our shielding technology approaches perfection, our engineers now pushing the capabilities of our shield systems right to their theoretical limits.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersPointDefenseOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: Optimizing our point defense systems should lead to a number of different performance gains. Also importantly, less dead naval officers.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersCounterMeasureFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we have some field data on ECM suite performance, we've identified a number of different ways we can improve upon the design and construction of those systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersDroneSystemMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Drone systems dramatically increased the sheer volume of our point defense capabilities, so any small improvement in their design we can make should lead to significant cost or weight savings.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: We've blown up lots and lots of slabs of armor on the test range, and have come up with a few possible improvements we could make to our armor systems.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: Our armor systems have increased significantly in complexity. An increased effort to model their behavior under impact should help lead to more effective or efficient designs.

StringTable.Label: DLC_SpaceMonstersArmorMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Our mastery of hardening techniques is almost complete, and the galaxy trembles at the girth of our vessels. But even perfection can be improved upon it seems. Some more effort should lead to cheaper or more efficient armor systems.
